LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_PickUpAndHaul_: Pick Up And Haul is not installed
PUAH is optional, but will be enhanced if installed.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Opportunity_In:
<color=#999999>"</color><color=#87f6f6>... on the way to ...</color><color=#999999>"
Hauling on the way to a job is a vanilla feature, hence generally compatible with all mods. Some storage mods use delays, so are disallowed by default.
We skip opportunities when bleeding or forming a caravan.</color>
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_OpportunityAdv: Vanilla, Default, Pathfinding<color=#999999>: Maximum distance ratios (see tooltips).</color>
Vanilla<color=#999999>: Maximum distances/ratios to limit opportunities in exchange for performance.</color> Default, Pathfinding<color=#999999>: Soft limits used as a performance heuristic.</color>
Vanilla only<color=#999999>: Maximum region-look count (faster than pathfinding but variable distance—see tooltip).</color>
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_HaulBeforeCarr:
<color=#999999>"</color><color=#87f6f6>... closer to ...</color><color=#999999>"
A pawn will find the closest resource, which is sometimes awaiting delivery to storage near our job site. By doing that first, our pawn can grab extras.</color>
<color=#999999>If a resource is already in storage, our pawn won't save a trip for a dedicated hauler, but can still grab extras that expedite their future work.</color>
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_PickUpAndHaulP:
Pick Up And Haul
<color=#999999>Pawns will unload once at each destination, in closest order.
Haulable destinations are cached to improve performance.</color>
Hauls of Opportunity
<color=#999999>Gathering and unloading a pawn's entire inventory will never exceed the criteria for "opportunistic".</color>
Supplies & Ingredients
<color=#999999>Pawns hauling extra supplies or ingredients to closer storage will also grab non-resources, unless bleeding.</color>
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Tooltip_Enable: Toggle entire mod without restarting. Useful for troubleshooting.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Label_UsePickU: Use & improve Pick Up And Haul
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Tooltip_DrawSp: Original job paths are red, new opportunistic paths are green. Original ingredient/supply paths are magenta, new optimal paths are cyan. Yellow paths are rejected, inopportune unloading alternatives when original cell has become occupied. (This is sync'd to vanilla's Development mode → inspector icon → Visibility → Draw Opportunistic Jobs.)
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Tooltip_Opport:
Our default is performant, but impassable walls and locked doors are ignored until a final check—which means no opportunity if it fails. These circumstances are less common with an open base.
"Pathfind during search" is slow, but guaranteed to find an opportunity if it exists. Recommended for small colonies, fast machines, or those desperate for hauls in a mountain base.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Label_Opportun: Within ranges & region count (vanilla) FPS: ★★★★ Opportunities: ★☆☆☆
Pathfind once after search (default) FPS: ★★★☆ Opportunities: ★★★☆
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Tooltip_Opport:
If (<color=#dcffaf>start</color>➡<color=#87f6f6>haulable</color>) exceeds this value, the haul is disqualified.
"Start" is the pawn's starting location, If a haulable is farther from the pawn's starting position than this, the haul is disqualified.

If (<color=#d09b61>storage</color>➡<color=#d46f68>job</color>) exceeds this value, the haul is disqualified.
If a haulable's storage is farther from the pawn's ending position than this, the haul is disqualified.
If (<color=#dcffaf>start</color>➡<color=#87f6f6>haulable</color> / <color=#dcffaf>start</color>➡<color=#d46f68>job</color>) exceeds this percentage, the haul is disqualified.
If (<color=#d09b61>storage</color>➡<color=#d46f68>job</color> / <color=#dcffaf>start</color>➡<color=#d46f68>job</color>) exceeds this percentage, the haul is disqualified.
This is a ratio of the "additional legs" of the new trip to the original trip.
This is a ratio of the new trip to the original trip.

To understand this, enable Development mode → inspector icon → Visibility → Draw Regions. Exploration begins from the start region spreading out to all neighbors until encountering the destination region. This setting caps the total number explored - even those in the wrong direction. It can't be calculated perfectly from distance, as regions will vary in size and neighbors. (A corridor has only forward and back, so they're explored further.) But in a completely open field, if a pawn must travel the distance of n=3 full-sized 12x12 regions (~36 tiles), the algorithm will explore 2(n^2+n)+1 or 25 regions.

To understand this, enable Development mode → inspector icon → Visibility → Draw Regions. Exploration begins from the start region spreading out to all neighbors until encountering the destination region. This setting caps the total number explored - even those in the wrong direction. It can't be calculated perfectly from distance, as regions will vary in size and neighbors. (A corridor has only forward and back, so they're explored further.) But in a completely open field, if a pawn must travel the distance of n=3 full-sized 12x12 regions (~36 tiles), the algorithm will explore 2(n^2+n)+1 or 25 regions.
LanguageData.CodeOptimist.WhileYoureUp_Label_HaulBefo: Haul extra resources closer from same-priority storage
